newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela CANTV, unions still working on wage deal.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela CANTV, unions still working on wage deal.

text.p: Venezuelan telephone company CANTV is due to meet with striking union representatives Tuesday to consider a Labor Ministry proposal to break an impasse over wage contracts, union representatives said.

The meeting, with the Labor Ministry mediating, was due to begin at 1000 local time/0900 EDT/1400 GMT. "But we still haven't started the discussions yet," Audio Rincon, secretary general of the umbrella telecommunications union group Fetratel, told Reuters.
The unions have been on strike since March 13.
"All we want is a fair wage increase," Cruz Hernandez, Fetratel president, told Reuters earlier Tuesday.
So far, the unions have rejected outright a series of offers by management, and the Labor Ministry's proposal is being treated by both parties as "a working proposal."
On Monday, CANTV president Gustavo Roosen said he hoped the negotiations would be successfully concluded without the need for third party arbitration.
Fetratel groups some 6,500 workers of CANTV's 17,300 total workforce.
